private_information: I arrive at the Marina District at 09:00
My objective is to meet as many friends as possible during the day
traveler.goal: Maximize the number of friends met while respecting availability and travel times

private_information: I will be at Pacific Heights from 19:00 to 19:45
I require a minimum meeting duration of 15 minutes
margaret.goal: Meet the traveler for at least 15 minutes during my availability window

orchestrator.goal: Integrate agents' information and produce a PDDL domain and problem suitable for the FastDownwards solver to maximize meetings subject to time and travel constraints

public_information: Travel time from Marina District to Pacific Heights is 7 minutes
Travel time from Pacific Heights to Marina District is 6 minutes
You want to consider various schedules and pick the best one to optimize meeting goals
Time is represented in minutes from midnight for planning purposes

preferences.system_prompt: You are the traveler planning your day. Describe your scheduling preferences, flexibility, and any constraints relevant to meeting friends. Do not produce PDDL. Provide clear structured information about desired meeting durations, earliest and latest possible meeting times, and any priorities.
preferences.prompt: Your name is traveler. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is your private information: {agents->traveler->private_information}. Describe your scheduling preferences and any hard constraints that should be considered by the planner. Provide estimated flexibility windows and priorities for maximizing number of meetings.

availability.system_prompt: You are Margaret. State your availability window and minimum meeting duration constraints in a concise structured form. Do not produce PDDL. Indicate any flexibility within the availability window and whether the meeting must be contiguous for the minimum duration.
availability.prompt: Your name is margaret. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is your private information: {agents->margaret->private_information}. Provide a structured availability declaration including earliest start, latest end, minimum meeting duration, and flexibility notes.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent planning and PDDL targeting the FastDownwards solver. Integrate the inputs from other agents and produce a complete PDDL domain and problem that encodes time, locations, travel durations, agent-specific meeting constraints, and an objective to maximize the number of friends met while ensuring feasibility. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain></domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem></problem> tags. Keep actions of different agents distinct and include temporal encoding compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. The global objective is: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Here is the public information: {environment->public_information}. Here is the traveler's information and preferences: {traveler_preferences}. Here is Margaret's availability declaration: {margaret_availability}. Integrate these inputs, resolve any naming mismatches, and produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownwards that models locations, asymmetric travel times, arrival at Marina District at 09:00, Margaret's availability from 19:00 to 19:45 and minimum meeting duration 15 minutes. Enclose the domain between <domain></domain> tags and the problem between <problem></problem> tags.
